meanings.definition: To utter a loud, prolonged, mournful cry or howl.
meanings.sent1: The wolf behowls at the moon every night.
meanings.sent2: The dog behowls when it hears a siren.
meanings.sent3: The lonely ghost behowls in the abandoned house.
meanings.sent4: The wind behowls through the trees on stormy nights.
meanings.sent5: The singer's voice behowls with emotion during the sad song.

meanings.definition: To fill or resound with howling sounds.
meanings.sent1: The valley behowls with the echoes of the howling wolves.
meanings.sent2: The forest behowls with the sounds of the wild animals at night.
meanings.sent3: The haunted castle behowls with ghostly wails.
meanings.sent4: The stadium behowls with cheers after the winning goal.
meanings.sent5: The night behowls with the wind as it sweeps through the city streets.
